FuncDef:
The ds-lite alarm address-group port-number threshold command sets alarm thresholds for port usage and port pre-allocation usage in a DS-Lite address pool so that a device generates an alarm if usage exceeds the specified threshold.
The undo ds-lite alarm address-group port-number threshold command restores the default alarm thresholds for port usage and port pre-allocation usage in a DS-Lite address pool.
The default alarm thresholds for port usage and port pre-allocation usage in a DS-Lite address pool are 80%.
CLIs: undo ds-lite alarm address-group port-number threshold [ <threshold-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Sets an alarm threshold for the number of used ports and the number of port pre-allocation times in a DS-Lite address pool.
Port pre-allocation ratio of a DS-Lite address pool = Number of times that port pre-allocation is performed in the DS-Lite address pool/Maximum number of times that port pre-allocation can be performed in the DS-Lite address pool.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 100, in percentage. The default value is 80.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If you want to monitor port usage and port pre-allocation usage of every DS-Lite address pool on a DS-Lite device, run the ds-lite alarm address-group port-number threshold command to set an alarm threshold of every DS-Lite address pool.
Configuration Impact
If DS-Lite port usage reaches the specified alarm threshold, a service board sends an alarm to the NMS. If DS-Lite port usage exceeds the alarm threshold, the service board does not repeatedly send an alarm. After DS-Lite port usage falls to 87.5%, the service board sends a clear alarm to the NMS.
Precautions
The ds-lite alarm address-group port-number threshold command takes effect on all address pools of a DS-Lite instance.
